perturbation.original_text:
The execution, validity, interpretation, enforcement and dispute resolution of this Agreement shall be governed by the PRC Law.

Any dispute, conflict or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the performance hereof shall be resolved by the Parties through amicable negotiation, which negotiation shall commence immediately upon notice by one Party to the other of the nature of such dispute, conflict or claim. In the event that such dispute is not resolved within thirty (30) Business Days following such notice,
either Party may upon the expiration of the such 30-day notice period submit such dispute to arbitration by the Hong Kong International
Arbitration Centre in accordance with the arbitration rules of such centre then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted in Hong
Kong in English and the arbitral award shall be binding upon both Parties. During the resolution (including the arbitration) of the
dispute, the Parties shall continue to perform other portions of this Agreement unaffected by such dispute.
perturbation.changed_text:
The execution, validity, interpretation, enforcement and dispute resolution of this Agreement shall be governed by the PRC Law.

Any dispute, conflict or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the performance hereof shall be resolved by the Parties through amicable negotiation, which negotiation shall commence immediately upon notice by one Party to the other of the nature of such dispute, conflict or claim. In the event that such dispute is not resolved within thirty (30) Business Days following such notice,
either Party may upon the expiration of the such 30-day notice period submit such dispute to arbitration if both parties agree, otherwise either party may seek resolution in a jurisdiction of their choosing. The arbitration, if agreed upon, shall be conducted in Hong
Kong in English and the arbitral award shall be binding upon both Parties only if both parties consent to the outcome. During the resolution of the
dispute, the Parties shall continue to perform other portions of this Agreement unaffected by such dispute.
perturbation.explanation: By adding 'if both parties agree, otherwise either party may seek resolution in a jurisdiction of their choosing,' the mandatory arbitration clause is weakened. Furthermore, making the arbitral award binding 'only if both parties consent to the outcome' undermines the purpose of arbitration, which is to provide a binding resolution. This reduces the enforceability of the original dispute resolution mechanism.
perturbation.location: ARTICLE ELEVEN APPLICABLE LAW; DISPUTE RESOLUTION

perturbation.original_text:
Party B warrants that it will take all technical methods and confidential measures reasonably available to Party B to ensure that only Party A and
certain of Party B personnel designated by Party A may have access to the Program Content licensed by Party A to Party B. Without
Party A’s permission in writing, Party B may not disclose or sublicense the Program Content to any third party, except for the Program
Content related to Party B Business.
perturbation.changed_text: Party B warrants that it will take some technical methods and confidential measures available to Party B to ensure that only Party A and some of Party B personnel designated by Party A may have access to the Program Content licensed by Party A to Party B. With Party A’s permission, Party B may disclose or sublicense the Program Content to any third party, including program content that is not related to Party B Business.
perturbation.explanation: Weakens security of Program Content. Changing 'all technical methods and confidential measures reasonably available' to 'some technical methods available' reduces the required level of effort for protecting the content. Removing 'Without Party A's permission in writing, Party B may not disclose or sublicense the Program Content to any third party, except for the Program Content related to Party B Business' and replacing with 'With Party A’s permission, Party B may disclose or sublicense the Program Content to any third party, including program content that is not related to Party B Business.' drastically changes the confidentiality and licensing terms, allowing Party B to freely sublicense content even if it is not related to their business, given Party A's permission.
perturbation.contradicted_law: PRC Contract Law regarding confidentiality and intellectual property rights
perturbation.location: ARTICLE SIX PARTY B’S OBLIGATIONS WITH RESPECT TO CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION

perturbation.original_text:
Both Parties agree that any breach of any of the warranties, covenants, or provisions hereof by either Party shall constitute a breach of this
Agreement, except under circumstances described in Section 8.2 below. In the event of any breach of this Agreement by any Party
herto, the breaching Party shall indemnify the other Party for all of such other Parties losses arising therefrom, which losses shall
include only direct losses, reasonable expenses and reasonable attorney fees.
perturbation.changed_text:
Both Parties agree that any breach of any of the warranties, covenants, or provisions hereof by either Party may constitute a breach of this
Agreement, except under circumstances described in Section 8.2 below. In the event of any breach of this Agreement by any Party
herto, the breaching Party may indemnify the other Party for only some of such other Parties losses arising therefrom, which losses may
include only some direct losses and attorney fees.
perturbation.explanation: Weakens the consequence of breach. Changing 'shall constitute a breach' to 'may constitute a breach' makes the determination of a breach discretionary. Replacing 'shall indemnify... for all of such other Parties losses' with 'may indemnify... for only some of such other Parties losses' reduces the obligation to compensate for losses and limits the scope of compensation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: PRC Contract Law regarding breach of contract and remedies
perturbation.location: ARTICLE EIGHT LIABILITIES FOR BREACH; TERMINATION
